channel.title: EP2 Vort
channel.description: Does anyone know how to get the vorts in HL2 to look like the vorts in EP2?

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: The_Javid
item.description:
Alien Slave:

I agree…

I preferred the wrinkly dry texture to the slug-like skin, primarily because it was closer to the Half-Life 1 Vorts.

Like I said earlier I think that would be easy all you have to do is open the “source models.gcf” copy the model files for the vort and paste them in a folder labled “models” in your “HL2” folder. Then you open the “source materials.gcf” and copy the textures for the vort and place them in a folder labled “Vortiguant” which is in your “models” folder that is in your “materials” folder that is in the “HL2” folder. If one or more of these folders do not exist you need to create them. I am fairly certain it will work. Try it and if it doesn’t work then post back and I’ll try to give you another solution.

Read full topic

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: Alien_Slave
item.description:
Psyborg:

I think it would be more worth the effort to port the Half Life 2 vorts into Episode 2. The slug-slime-covered babyskinned vorts just threw me the hell off.

I agree…

I preferred the wrinkly dry texture to the slug-like skin, primarily because it was closer to the Half-Life 1 Vorts.

Read full topic

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: The_Javid
item.description:
raw_bean:

Hmmm, was it fairly straightforward? Which version was it? I’d love to play HL2 in the OB engine, so I might have to try that myself.

It was version 8 all I did was delete all the textures, selected the original characters in the character pimper, copy the models of the vort from the “episode two.gcf” and the textures from the “source 2007 shared materials.gcf” and then delete FF’s “Skill.cfg”. It took me a while to get everything right but it was worth it in the end I think.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: The_Javid
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

Didn’t FakeFactory convert HL2 tro the ep2 engine? If he did, you could install that and remove all of the shit except the vorigaunt.

Just so everyone knows this suggestion worked. I would like to thank everyone for their suggestions and help.

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
And the one you can see shooting electricity at Combine after you get separated from Alyx at the end of Black Mesa: East/beginning of Ravenholme. I mean, two of the ones at the Vort camp are the hilarious ones that promise to use English unless they have unflattering things to say about you, then go ahead and (presumably) say a load of unflattering things about you, how could you forget? pwn3d indeed.

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: The_Javid
item.description:
Kera:

HL2 is ported to the Source Engine 2(Orange Box Engine) - look at the top right of the screen with the dev console open, and it should display the same version as Ep.1 and Ep.2.

Sorry if this is incorrect, it’s from the Dev Wiki and HL2 forums, and I’m not very Source-savy

EDIT: Too confusing want simpler; HL2 was ported to the Ep.1 engine, and later the Ep.2 engine(same with Ep.1) supposedly.

well I downloaded a phong vort texture and it wouldn’t work in HL2.

Read full topic

item.title: EP2 Vort
item.dc:creator: The_Javid
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

HEV gloves have reflective maps, not PHong shading.

In the Xbox 360 version of the OB, all of the vorts use the Ep2 model.

I myself am wondering how I would go about finding everything to convert the new ones into the old ones, so they’re more rusty lookin’.

So how would one go about creating a reflective map for the Vorts that would make them similarly reflective? I think your situation is easier to fix, due to there not being engine limitations for the effects of the HL2 vorts. I haven’t tried it but if you took the vort models(minus the animations) and textures out of the half-life 2 gfc’s and placed them in the appropriate folders for ep1 and ep2 I believe that would work.

Read full topic
